result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon S. Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathon S. Fischer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonathon S. Fischer was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Jonathon S. Fischer was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Current: N2453 10th Ave, Montello, WI 53949 United States  (Effective: 08-24-2016)

Hearing on May 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Request for fulough from Jonathon Fischer
- gave a copy to MASO 4-21-16.  mkv

STAO to amend sentence credit to being 7 days.
JOC to be amended.
Judge signed Order 04-19-16

Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by phone means for Defendant Jonathon S. Fischer. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jonathon S. Fischer in court.
15CT27 & 15CM116 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that this is the defendant's motion.  Atty Frank asks the court for huber to allow counseling.  Atty Hendee has no objection to the huber request to include counseling.
Atty Hendee has an objection to electronic monitoring.

BY THE COURT:  Court grants part of the motion, JOC be amended to:  Huber will include counseling or medical appointments as long as the defendant provides a Dr.'s note that he had the medical appointment.
Court denies the motion for electronic monitoring.

Defendant states that credit was not on the JOC either.  Atty Hendee will communicate with Atty Frank regarding that credit and it will get done through a stipulation.
Motion hearing on April 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.
FROM ATTY FRANK REQUESTING AMENDMENT

Defendant Jonathon S. Fischer in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM116, 15CT27, 15CT72 along with 15TR425-429 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CT27, Ct. 1 in 15CT72 and Counts 1 & 3 in 15CM116.  All other counts along with the 15TR425 - 429 to be dismissed.  15TR524 to be vacated and reopened; state moves to dismiss then.
Atty Frank agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CT27, Ct. 1 in 15CT72 and Counts 1 & 3 in 15CM116.  All other counts along with the 15TR425 - 429 to be dismissed.  
15TR524 to be vacated, reopened and dismissed.

  State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations on 15CM116.
Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments on 15CM116 and asks the court to order Probation.
Shannon Duesterhoeft makes a statement to the court.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  15CT27:  Ct. 1, OWI -3rd offense:  Court orders 45 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
Report forthwith
*First 48 hours to be without huber
*Pay fine and costs = $1,694.00 (DNA surcharge included)
*24 month DL Revocation and Ignition Interlock
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*DNA Sample
Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed.

15CT72:  Ct. 1: Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $200.00 Surcharge
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

15CM116:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 90 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to all other sentences
*Court Costs = $243.00
*Domestic Abuse Surcharge = $100.00
*DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $200.00 Surcharge

Ct. 3:  Court orders 180 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to Ct. 1 and the OWI sentence in 15CT27:
*Court Costs = $243.00
*DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $200.00 Surcharge
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

15TR425 - 15TR429 to be dismissed.
15TR524 to be dismissed.

Credit will be determined by Counsel through a stipulation.
Plea hearing at 03-16-2016 02:45 pm
Plea hearing at 03-04-2016 02:00 pm
Authorization for Attorney to Appear
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-06-2016 10:00 am

Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there has been discussions regarding settlement and an offer has been provided.  Atty Frank agrees and states that the parties are close to resolution and files an authorization with the court.  Atty Frank asks for an argued plea/sentencing.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing.
bond continued.
JT should be removed from the calendar on 15CT27 and should track with this case.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
STATE'S
amended as to condition

**AMENDED BOND CONDITION:
*No violent or abusive contact with Shannon Duesterhoeft
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by phone means for Defendant Jonathon S. Fischer. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jonathon S. Fischer in court.
Victim Shannon Duesterhoeft also appears in court.
Atty Hendee states that Ms. Duesterhoeft would like to amend the bond conditions.  Atty Frank states that the victim requested the hearing through Hope House.  Ms. Duesterhoeft makes a statement to the court and requests that the no contact be lifted from the bond condition.
Atty Hendee makes arguments regarding the no contact be lifted and the State is objecting to the modification.
Atty Frank makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court will amend the no contact bond condition to No Violent or Abusive contact with Shannon Duesterhoeft.
Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
PETITION FOR LEAVE TO FILE ADDITIONAL MOTIONS
Statement of Compliance

Pre-trial conference at 09-08-2015 10:30 am.
Return date at 10-07-2015 03:30 pm.

with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*No contact with Shannon Duesterhoeft

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant has no questions.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant is on a Probation Hold.

Court finds probable cause.  
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial.

Defendant Jonathon S. Fischer in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*No contact with Shannon Duesterhoeft  Return date scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
